business.headline: Explained: Why PC Jeweller share price hit upper circuit limit of 5% todayPC Jeweller stock: PC Jeweller share price rose 5% in early trade on Monday after a major announcement from the company.
Bitcoin hits record high, soars over $106,000. 3 things to knowBitcoin, the world's leading cryptocurrency, reached a record high above $106,000, driving positive momentum in other cryptos.

Ustad Zakir Hussain's net worth: How much did tabla maestro earn per concert?Ustad Zakir Hussain's family confirmed his death on Monday, following his hospitalisation for two weeks, during which his condition worsened, and he was moved to the ICU.

Sai Life Sciences IPO allotment: Check status, GMP, and listing dateSai Life Sciences IPO allotment: Investors who applied for the Sai Life Sciences IPO can check their allotment status on the BSE and Kfin Technologies Limited websites.

Why Narayana Murthy believes Indians should work 70 hours a weekNarayana Murthy has stood by his stance on work-life balance and his recent comments come amid continued debate over his previous suggestion that young Indians should commit to a 70-hour work week.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: Online guide to check status. See latest GMPVishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: Investors who applied for the Vishal Mega Mart IPO can check their allotment status on the BSE and KFin Technologies Limited websites.

Mobikwik IPO allotment status: Where to check? GMP, expected listing dateMobikwik IPO allotment status: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag; bearish trends continueThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 279.70 points to 81,853.42, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 74 points to 24,694.30.

Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

Sensex gains 700 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatility todayStock market rebound: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 730.39 points to 82,020.35, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 192.70 points to 24,741.40, as of 3 PM.

Mobikwik IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut amid heavy demand?Mobikwik IPO has seen very strong demand among investors and was fully booked within the first hour of opening for subscription.
Sensex back in green: Airtel, HUL, and IT stocks lead market rebound As of 12:52 PM, Sensex was up by 111.46 points to 81,401.42, while Nifty50 gained 12.75 points to 24,561.45.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO last day: Check gmp, subscription. Shoud you subscribe?Vishal Mega Mart IPO has set a price range of Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share. Retail investors need to purchase a minimum of 190 shares in a single lot, requiring an initial investment of Rs 14,820.
Azim Premji, Ranjan Pai to buy a minority stake in Akasa Air: ReportAzim Premji and Ranjan Pai family offices acquired a minority stake in Akasa Air as part of a $130-140 million fundraising round.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Mallikarjun Kharge's dig at Nirmala Sitharaman for Nehru attack: Studied in JNUMallikarjun Kharge took potshots at Nirmala Sitharaman in Rajya Sabha after the Union minister slammed Jawaharlal Nehru for curtailing freedom of speech.

Pollution curbs under GRAP-III back in Delhi, hybrid mode for up to Class 5The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has again implemented phase three of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) across Delhi-NCR following a significant rise in pollution levels.

Nirmala Sitharaman invokes Balraj Sahni's arrest to slam Nehru over Constitution  Live UpdatesNirmala Sitharaman, keeping up the attack on the Gandhi family after PM Modi's explosive speech, said the first Constitutional amendment was brought by Nehru in 1951 to curb freedom of speech.

Priyanka Gandhi makes a statement with 'Palestine' bag in Parliament, BJP reactsA photo of Priyanka Gandhi toting around a bag emblazoned with 'Palestine' on Parliament premises was shared on social media by Congress spokesperson Shama Mohamed.

What's in Nehru's Edwina letters and why a storm after 80 years?The Prime Ministers' Museum and Library has requested the return of personal letters written by Jawaharlal Nehru to Edwina Mountbatten, Jayaprakash Narayan, and Albert Einstein, among others. The focus is, however, on Nehru's letters to Edwina. What is in these letters that the BJP allege have been carted away by Congress leader Sonia Gandhi?

Zakir Hussain dies from rare lung disease: What is it?Tabla virtuoso Zakir Hussain passed away in a San Francisco hospital due to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. The condition causes lung tissue scarring.

Pollution pan-India problem: Supreme Court seeks list of most polluted citiesThe Supreme Court on Monday said it would expand the scope of the PIL to other states and areas outside NCR due to rising pollution.

India makes big discovery in the depths of Southern Indian OceanUsing the Autonomous Underwater Vehicle (AUV), developed by NIOT, the team led by Dr. NR Ramesh was able to capture detailed images and gather critical data from the hydrothermal vents.

MEC 7 fitness units, mushrooming in Kerala, infiltrated by Islamic radicals?A fitness programme in Kerala, MEC 7, is under scrutiny for allegedly being used by banned groups like PFI and Jama'at-e-Islami to spread radicalism. Both the CPI(M) and the BJP have raised concerns that MEC 7, which operates over 1,000 units across northern Kerala, had allegedly been infiltrated by Islamist radicals.

3 damaged idols unearthed at temple in UP's Sambhal that reopened after 46 yearsThe excavated idols, which appear to be those of Goddesses Parvati and Lakshmi, were found in a damaged condition after the temple's first reopening since 1978.

Google my record: Jasprit Bumrah jokes after reporter questions his batting skillsAustralia vs India, 3rd Test: Jasprit Bumrah was not impressed when a reporter questioned his batting skills after the third day's play in Brisbane. The India fast bowler jokingly told the scribe to google his batting record.

Mysterious drone sightings spook Americans, sparks new theoryMysterious drone sightings in New Jersey and other East Coast states have caused widespread concern among Americans. While US government agencies insist they pose no threat, new theories suggest the drones might be searching for specific substances, leaving the public uneasy.

Slap us if you want: YesMadam CEO apologises for stress survey campaignIn a video statement posted on LinkedIn, Mayank Arya, CEO of YesMadam, apologised for his company's "planned effort" to raise awareness regarding workplace stress.

PM expresses condolence on Zakir Hussain's death: Will be remembered as true geniusZakir Hussain Death: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed condolence on the death of tabla maestro Zakir Hussain, saying he will be remembered as a true genius who revolutionised the world of Indian classical music.

Australia break India's Gabba pride between frequent rain breaks on Day 3India's resistance at Gabba seemed to be slowly fading away as the top order suffered yet another collapse on Day 3 of the third Test in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy on Monday, December 16. The day was marred by constant rain delays, which could prove to be a blessing in disguise for India in the end.

'Why this approach after being Chief Minister': Congress vs Omar Abdullah on EVMsCongress MP Manickam Tagore asked the Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister to check his facts after Omar Abdullah questioned the Congress's stance on EVMs.

Celebrating Zakir Hussain: Lesser known stories about India's tabla iconZakir Hussain, India's tabla maestro, passed away on the morning of December 16, 2024, at 73. Here's more about his lesser-known life moments and legacy that have profoundly influenced Indian classical music.

India job outlook 2025: How IT, energy, infra, logistics will drive hiringThe ManpowerGroup Employment Outlook report says IT firms are the most optimistic, with 50 per cent planning to boost workforce, followed by real estate and consumer goods-services

Lying is in Congress's blood: Nirmala Sitharaman amid fiery Constitution debate Live UpdatesRajya Sabha Constitution Debate: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman accused the Congress of repeatedly amending the Constitution to safeguard its leadership and dynasty, rather than to strengthen democracy.

Diljit Dosanjh sneers at row over 'Panjab' spelling: Everything is a conspiracyDiljit Dosanjh found himself in hot water after spelling 'Punjab' as 'Panjab' in a social media post. Today, the singer-actor cleared his stance on X.

Mysterious signal recorded buzzing from deep space every 2.9 hoursThe bursts are not only periodic but also highly organised and polarised, resembling the emissions seen from pulsars — rapidly spinning, highly magnetic neutron stars.

Friend in social sense: Shashi Tharoor's clarification as old Soros post surfacesCongress leader Shashi Tharoor's clarification comes after a 15-year-old tweet resurfaced, where he referred to US billionaire investor George Soros as an "old friend."

Zakir Hussain: The tabla maverick who made the world go 'Wah, ustad'Tabla legend Zakir Hussain, known for his rhythmic brilliance and global musical collaborations, died in a hospital in the US due to chronic lung disease.

Why Narayana Murthy believes Indians should work 70 hours a weekNarayana Murthy has stood by his stance on work-life balance and his recent comments come amid continued debate over his previous suggestion that young Indians should commit to a 70-hour work week.

When maestro Zakir Hussain re-created sounds of damru, shankh on his tablaRenowned tabla virtuoso Zakir Hussain died at 73 in San Francisco. In a now viral video, the maestro can be seen recreating the sounds of damru and shankh on the tabla.

Veteran classical singer Pandit Sanjay Ram Marathe, 68, dies of heart attackVeteran classical singer Pandit Sanjay Ram Marathe died at 68 of heart attack in Thane, Maharashtra. The artist, known for his expertise in harmonium, leaves a legacy rooted in Indian classical music and theatre.

Director Vignesh Shivan clarifies on rumours of acquiring government propertyRecently, rumours surfaced that director Vignesh Shivan was planning to acquire a government property in Puducherry. The filmmaker has issued a statement clarifying his stance.

Shyam Benegal's 90th birthday: Film legends gather in one frameVeteran actors like Shabana Azmi and Naseeruddin Shah reunited to celebrate filmmaker Shyam Benegal's 90th birthday. Azmi shared heartfelt photos from the gathering, reminiscing about their iconic collaborations.

sports.headline: Rohit my brother, play with more energy: Hayden's message to India captainMatthew Hayden urged Rohit Sharma to bat with energy on Day 4, believing India's captain had a chance to redeem his form and lead the fightback after their top-order collapse against Australia in the Brisbane Test.

Indian pace bowling in transition, it's my job to help others: Jasprit BumrahAustralia vs India, 3rd Test: Concerns have been raised about Jasprit Bumrah's workload during the ongoing five-Test series, but the vice-captain stressed the importance of helping a young bowling attack adapt to the demands of red-ball cricket in challenging conditions Down Under.

I love Siraj's fighting spirit: Bumrah dismisses concerns over pacer's formBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Jasprit Bumrah played down talks of burnout and said it's important for him to lead an inexperienced bowling attack in Australia. Bumrah also played down concerns over Mohammed Siraj's bowling form Down Under.

Marsh reveals reason behind animated celebration after Shubman Gill catchMitchell Marsh's spectacular gully catch to dismiss Shubman Gill, coupled with animated celebrations aimed at amusing teammates, capped a brilliant fielding effort that helped Australia mount immense pressure on India during Day 3 of the Brisbane Test.

The India fast bowler jokingly told the scribe to google his batting record.

Tim Southee on missing 100-sixes landmark in final Test: Sorry to disappointNew Zealand fast bowler Tim Southee missed out on entering the 100-sixes club in Test cricket as he finished his career with 98 sixes on Day 3 of the third Test vs England.

Jason Gillespie slams Pakistan board, details reasons behind resignationFormer Pakistan Test team coach Jason Gillespie has detailed the reasons behind his unceremonious exit from his role. Gillespie, who took up the role in April, decided to quit right before the South Africa Tests got underway.

Ben Stokes injury plagues England as New Zealand sniff consolation winNew Zealand tightened their grip on the third Test, setting England a mammoth 658-run target as early wickets and Ben Stokes' hamstring injury compounded England's misery, leaving them reeling at 18/2 at stumps on Day 3 in Hamilton.

Youngest chess champion D Gukesh's receives grand welcome as he returns home The youngest world champion in the history of chess, Gukesh, arrived in Chennai with a grand welcome.

Hero's welcome for D Gukesh: Thousands greet world chess champion in ChennaiGukesh Dommaraju was greeted by thousands of fans when he returned to Chennai on Monday, December 16. A specially-designed car was at the airport to escort the youngest world chess champion to his residence.

AUS vs IND: Cummins spoils Gabba hero Rishabh Pant's long-awaited returnPat Cummins continued to dominate Rishabh Pant in the ongoing Border Gavaskar Trophy, dismissing him yet again in the Brisbane Test, leaving India in deep trouble after their top order collapse.

Sunil Gavaskar suggests Sachin Tendulkar lesson to struggling Virat Kohli Australia vs India, 3rd Test: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar said Virat Kohli should learn from Sachin Tendulkar's iconic 241 in Sydney to overcome his struggle with deliveries bowled in the line outside the off-stump. Kohli was dismissed for 3 while trying to play an expansive cover drive on Monday in Brisbane.

WI vs BAN: Mahedi, Mahmud star as Powell's heroics go in vain in 1st T20IRovman Powell's heroic innings went in vain as Mahedi and Mahmud bowled Bangladesh to a 7-run win in St. Vincent on Sunday, December 9. Mahedi picked up 4 wickets and scored a vital 26 runs to help secure the win for his side.

Watch: KL Rahul, Starc distraught after 5th rain interruption in GabbaRain interruptions frustrated KL Rahul and Mitchell Starc during Day 3 of the Brisbane Test, as recurring delays halted play five times, adding to the dismay after India's top-order collapse against Australia's potent bowling attack.

Sanjay Manjrekar questions role of batting coach after Brisbane collapseFormer India cricketer turned commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has questioned the role of batting coach in the Indian support staff after the constant failures of the batting unit in Test cricket.

Pep Guardiola accepts blame after City's collapse in derby: I'm not good enoughPep Guardiola has taken the full blame for Manchester City's collapse against Manchester United during the derby on Monday, December 16. City let a lead slip in the final few minutes to let United secure a comeback win.

NZ vs ENG: Stokes faces fresh injury concern after limping off the fieldBen Stokes suffered a fresh hamstring injury on Day 3 of the third Test against New Zealand, raising concerns for England after he limped off the field in visible discomfort, clutching the same hamstring he injured earlier this year.

India 'flat attitude' on Day 3 creeping into batting as well: Deep DasguptaDeep Dasgupta feels that India's 'flat attitude' on the field during Day 3 has crept into their batting as well on Monday, December 16. India's top-order collapsed on Monday after Australia put up 445 in the first innings.

Why Kohli will be disappointed with Gabba Test dismissal: Bangar revealsVirat Kohli's recurring dismissal pattern continued in the Brisbane Test as he fell to Josh Hazlewood, edging a fuller delivery outside off-stump. Former batting coach Sanjay Bangar called it an avoidable mistake, intensifying scrutiny over Kohli's struggles in the slot.

Watch: Mitchell Starc dismisses Yashasvi Jaiswal on 2nd ball with 'masterplan'Australia fast bowler Mitchell Starc dismissed Yashasvi Jaiswal on just the second ball of the Indian innings on Day 3 of the third Test at the Gabba in Brisbane.

Kohli edged and gone: Fans slam pattern after India star flops in BrisbaneVirat Kohli's dismissal pattern persisted as Josh Hazlewood exploited his weakness outside off-stump in the Gabba Test, raising concerns about the star batter's recurring struggles in the same slot.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
